alert.note: Alert for Darlington; Marlboro (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 07 at 4:50PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Darlington and southeastern Marlboro Counties through 530 PM EDT... At 450 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Brownsville, or 13 miles northeast of Darlington, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Brownsville, Mechanicsville, Dunbar and Blenheim. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
